metadata.title: CVE-2024-1549 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
If a website set a large custom cursor, portions of the cursor could haveoverlapped with the permission dialog, potentially resulting in userconfusion and unexpected granted permissions. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 123, Firefox ESR < 115.8, and Thunderbird < 115.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-1549` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 123.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 123.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 123.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:115.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '123.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.8.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
